citations.narrative:
In the goat enclosure, there are several areas of fencing in a state of disrepair. The chicken wire fencing material around
the entrance has become partially detached in multiple areas which has created sharp points and gaps at the level of the
goats.
Failure to maintain enclosure fencing can allow for gaps, unstable structures, or sharp points which can result in injury,
entrapment, or escape of the animals.
Facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them.
Correct by: 03/14/2024.

There were several sharp points observed in the large chicken enclosure. On the outdoor wooden feeder, 3- 4 sharp nails
and/or screws were protruding through the wood on each corner which allowed for sharp points to be at the level of the
chickens.
Enclosures with sharp points can cause injury to the animals.
The facility must remove the sharp points to ensure that the birds do not become injured.
Correct by: 02/21/2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written program for environment enhancement for their chickens. The birds appeared healthy
and had several enrichment opportunities in their enclosures, however, a documented program hasn't been developed.
A written plan for environment enrichment is necessary to ensure the psychological well-being and overall health of the
birds.
Exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a species- appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to
promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must address
social grouping, environmental enrichment, special considerations, and exemptions.
Correct by: 03/14/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
